item.title: [Python] Recursive function
item.description: First of all, since I often use tree-structured recursion as a tree information source, decision tree algorithm, etc., I would like to summarize recursive functions. A function that executes itself is called a recursive function, and the place of execution within itself of a recursive function is called a recursive call. def recursive_f(depth): print("depth: "+ str(depth)) if depth == 10: return recursive_f(depth + 1) if __name__=="__main__": recursive_f(0) The execution result will be as follows.
